"'''The Gods Return to Earth'''" is the title of the first literary review of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''. It was written by [[C.S. Lewis]] and originally published in ''Time and Tide'' on [[14 August]] [[1954]] (p. 1082) reviewing ''[[The Fellowship of the Ring]]''. 

In the article Lewis likened the book with a "lightning from a clear sky", and compared it to [[Wikipedia:William Blake|Blake's]] ''[[Wikipedia:Songs of Innocence|Songs of Innocence]]''. For him it marked a triumphant and relieving return of the heroic romance in the anti-romantic age, while at the same time being a revolutionary work in that genre.<ref>Quoted in {{HM|RC}}, p. xxxvi</ref>
